result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. McIntyre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles A. McIntyre

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 8:44 AM/Rm. 301. Defendant Charles A. McIntyre in court, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. continues to wish to represent self. State has filed information and given Def. copy. State has joint recommendation on Counts 1, 2 & 5, Def. to plea guilty or no contest, dismiss and read in Counts 3 & 4, withheld sentence, probation 3 years, Def. to pay court costs to include DNA surcharge, participate in AODA, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counselling as deemed fit by agent. Ct. 2 imposed and stayed, 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision to run consecutive, 3 years of probation to run concurrent to any other supervision and comply with conditions on Ct. 1. Def. to pay costs of action to include DNA surcharge. Ct. 5, time served with costs. State has complied with victim rights, no victim wished to speak today. Def. is in agreeance and notes disability regarding full time employment, requests community service. State acknowledges and agrees to standard community service in Langlade County, 100 hours of community service to be completed during 4 years of probation. Def. accepts plea agreement. Court reviews prelim hearing waiver with Def. Def. does wish to waive preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings, to include filing of information. Def. acknowledges receipt of waiver and waives formal reading. Court reviews plea questionnaire form and all potential penalties and charges with Def. Def. pleas no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 5. Court grants request to dismiss and read in counts 3 & 4. Court reviews Def. constitutional rights and elements. Def. understands and is in agreeance. Court finds Def. is entering pleas freely and voluntarily and has reviewed criminal complaint. Court finds adequate and factual basis, State is in agreeance. Court finds Def. guilty of Counts 1, 2 & 5. Court reviews elements of Count 2. Def. has no questions and is ready to move forward with sentencing. State gives sentencing remarks and requests Court adopt joint recommendation. Def. makes sentencing remarks. Court considers sentencing factors and finds Def. guilty on Ct. 1, withheld sentence, probation of 3 yeas, Def. pay court costs to include $250 DNA surcharge, comply with AODA treatment plan, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances,  Def. to complete 100 hours of community service on Ct. 1, participate in counselling or assessments agent finds beneficial. Ct. 2 imposed and stayed, 4 years prison, 2 years initial confinement. 2 years probation consecutive to any other sentence, probation 3 years, Def. to pay court costs to include $250 DNA surcharge and all other conditions as set forth in Ct. 1. Ct. 5 time served, 52 days jail, Def. to pay court costs to include $200 DNA surcharge. Def. must give sample if not already provided. Def. eligible for earned release, not eligible for challenge incarceration program. State in agreeance. Def. may not own or possess firearms and informed of voting rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Credit on Ct. 5 has been used, no days left over. Def. is informed of appeal rights. Ct. 1 and 2, costs paid during probation. Payment plan for costs on Ct. 5. Court questions Def. on income. Def. responds. Court gives Def. option of payment plan on Ct. 5 to begin in Jan. of 2023.

to be present at plea/sentencing
Routed to Judge's JA
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

regarding bond
(not routed to JA because addressed in court)

10:48 AM/Rm. 301/Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A. McIntyre appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail. All parties and Court Reporter by Zoom.  State objects to having bond hearing today.  Off record for scheduling/back on.  Bond hearing scheduled.  Wavier of right to attorney form given to Court.  Court reviews with Def.  Court finds Def. has freely and voluntarily waived right to counsel.  Court allows Def. to represent himself.  St. Conf. set.  Def. waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

for Bail Reduction
(Routed to CC's JA)

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substance without a prescription. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.
No contact with alleged victim.

1:08 PM Defendant Charles A. McIntyre appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State is in compliance with victim rights. State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions. Def. is on a probation hold. Def. heard on bond.  Court gives 3 factors of setting bond & orders $3,000 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substance without a prescription, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and No contact with alleged victim.  Def. questions about representing himself. CC informs def. policy.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
